rComments: She is the best prof I had: funny, respectul, and very helpful! She gives "questions of the day" every lecture and they are the SAME questions on the test and exam! Make sure you attend lecture to know the answer. In soc211 I got a 95% and in soc301 an 88%!!! Test material are from slides and readings, and GO to OFFICE HOURS for the paper!
teacherRatingTags: ['Inspirational', 'Gives good feedback', 'Respected']

rComments: Took my first class with her this year and she's a great professor. The lectures are honestly so clear and she goes over the concepts really well and thoroughly. She also provides you with study questions for each lecture that are essentially ideal exam prep (they actually do come up on the exams), which is really helpful. Would take again for sure
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: the most amazing prof if you put in effort into her course, office hours etc.
teacherRatingTags: ['Respected', 'Tough grader', 'Inspirational']

rComments: Although you must attend lecturers in order to complete the 10% "participation" of in class assignments, this class is extremely easy to do well in. I would study the night before/day of and got an A+ on the tests because she gives you the questions in advance for the 2 midterms and final exam.
teacherRatingTags: ['Respected', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: Professor Klassen is an amazing lecturer, she adds humour to lecture which makes it interesting and fun to learn about the course content. The test questions are given to you in advance so doing poorly is literally impossible unless you don't study them. I love that there are only tests, no assignments, it is a GPA booster for sure.
teacherRatingTags: ['Hilarious', 'Accessible outside class', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: Professor Klassen is funny, good at discussing material, and clearly intelligent. However, she's strict like a grade 10 highschool teacher. She'll call you out for being on your phone, and even if you leave early. She does mandatory in-class assignments worth 10% of your grade, so you must show up. Tests will make your hands HURT from writing.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Love the classes, she makes them interesting and give alot of information. Tests are the worse though, all short answer written answers but there is a specific answer key. Meaning I wrote an answer that was technically correct but it wasnt on the answer key so I almost failed. Typically written tests should have more leeway.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Amy seems funny but her TA's grade ridiculously. Hard to appeal a grade because there is so much grey area within the long answers on the test. You can think your answer is perfect, but if her TA's don't have the same opinion as you or perspective, you will fail. Your grade suffers. drop the class
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters']

rComments: Her lectures are amazing and easy to follow--just show up to class and you'll get all the info you need! Doing the required readings isn't necessary to pass but it's really helpful to understand Amy in lectures. Her tests were very fair. They were all short answer but she gives you the questions in her "question of the day" slide every lecture!
teacherRatingTags: ['Respected', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: No. Never again. Real tough. I'd appeal my grade but everyone's scared of her.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Test heavy', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Her lectures were clear and concise, and she attempted to keep them interesting. My issue with this class was that there were three marking points. Two tests and a final is not enough for the sheer volume of course content. Grading is all over the place and failure on the first test due to poor understanding of format could doom your mark early.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Amy was pretty funny, but tended to be heavy on readings, and is a little intimidating in general. I really liked her course, but if you can't keep up with the long and heavy readings, you'll have difficulty.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The lectures are probably the most informative out of all the sociology and criminology courses I have taken, but one must transfer all that info to the tests. The tests are all short answers and you have to memorize a lot for each question. I recommend that you start studying a couple days in advance as you will not pass if you cram in one night.
teacherRatingTags: ['Respected', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: I had Amy for soc211 and 219. I didn't do readings for both classes. They are not necessary. The key to passing is 1- go to class and 2 - do the questions of the day!! The tests are just like the questions of the day. Do them full out and give examples and you won't have a problem. The in-class assignments are annoying but they are an easy mark.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: There's only 2 tests and an exam in this class and she gives you all the questions for the test beforehand so it's pretty much just memorization. There's also a daily participation question based off the weekly readings.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Professor Klassen is such an amazing prof!
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Respected', 'Inspirational']

rComments: Literally the best Sociology class I ever took in my 4 years at Uof T. Course was super interesting.  She is beyond fair and cares about her students.  I wish more profs were like her
I've taken 3 classes with Professor Klassen.  I wish UTM would make her permanent faculty.   her classes are all awesome
Great class.  Prof is funny and makes the class relatable. Tests are fair. One of the best Profs at UTM
Great Prof.  Tests are fair but tough. Come to class.
Such a great profB
teacherRatingTags: ['Hilarious', 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: She's a great prof. Very straight forward with what she expects of you. At first she may seem really difficult or hard. But once you adjust to her style of teaching its not as hard. She wants you to learn which is important. In addition too, she does let you know the test questions ahead of time.

Amy is great! Her seminars are interesting and she uses real world examples in her material. The course load was heavy but she made sure you understood the material and would answer any questions. She is very easy to approach and has a great sense of humour. She cares about her students and it shows. I would recommend this class!
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Took her soc363 in the summer. The course load isn't too bad and the material is interesting. Her midterms and final is mostly in short-answer format and we also had mini short-answer assignments each class for participation. The class is only 2-hour lecture once a week, so if you need a soc credit, I would definitely recommend her.
teacherRatingTags: ['Hilarious', 'Participation matters', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Such a good prof! Was a bit worried at first because I had her as a TA  beforeand she was a bit harsh, but as a prof she's amazing! Lecturesare so easy to follow, no complex next-level language or terminology. Also, so funny! Always has interesting stories. Assignments are completely fair and straight-forward. Really wants the best for her students
teacherRatingTags: ['Caring', 'Hilarious', 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: Awesome Class and an awesome prof.  One of the best at U of T for sure.
She is an awesome Prof.  She is always available and cares about her students.  Her lectures are super interesting and the exams are fair.  I would totally take another class with her...

Teacher was ok. Average prof at best. Marks essays really hard. Drop your class if you have essay assignments worth a lot because you wont be getting 80s. Lucky if you get a 70 with her marking. Her tests are ok. Her exam reviews  are weak. Id avoid her for future.

Shes a good prof. Makes it sound like the class is going to be hard, but isnt so bad. Just study and you will do amazing. Talks about plagiarism every class! She said she only does that to scare the students. The essay was marked a bit hard, but the tests and exam are very fair! Lectures are very interesting. Would take another class with her!

She's a great prof and she definitely knows what she's talking about. Pretty crazy about plagiarism though.. She talks about it almost every class and warns us that we'll end up at the Dean's office if we cite incorrectly. The tests are extremely fair though and she explains everything really well beforehand.
